docs.text:
The 
drive2
 command-line interface 
(CLI)
 allows to use most features of the 
Google drive
 service from the comfort of your terminal.


By default all output is printed to standard out, but flags can be set to direct it into a file independent of your shell's
capabilities. Errors will be printed to standard error, and cause the program's exit code to be non-zero.


If data-structures are requested, these will be returned as pretty-printed JSON, to be useful as input to other tools.


Everything else about the 
drive
 API can be found at the

official documentation site
.


Downloads


You can download the pre-compiled 64bit binaries for the following platforms:




 
ubuntu


 
osx




Find the source code 
on github
.


Usage


This documentation was generated from the 
drive

20160126
. The CLI is at version 
0.3.3
.

  drive2 --help

Configuration:
  [--scope 
url
]...
            Specify the authentication a method should be executed in. Each scope
            requires the user to grant this application permission to use it.
            If unset, it defaults to the shortest scope url for a particular method.
  --config-dir 
folder

            A directory into which we will store our persistent data. Defaults to
            a user-writable directory that we will create during the first invocation.
            [default: ~/.google-service-cli]
  --debug
            Output all server communication to standard error. `tx` and `rx` are placed
            into the same stream.
  --debug-auth
            Output all communication related to authentication to standard error. `tx`
            and `rx` are placed into the same stream.





Configuration


The program will store all persistent data in the 
~/.google-service-cli
 directory in 
JSON
 files prefixed with 
drive2-
.  You can change the directory used to store configuration with the 
--config-dir
 flag on a per-invocation basis.


More information about the various kinds of persistent data are given in the following paragraphs.


Authentication


Most APIs require a user to authenticate any request. If this is the case, the 
scope
 determines the 
set of permissions granted. The granularity of these is usually no more than 
read-only
 or 
full-access
.


If not set, the system will automatically select the smallest feasible scope, e.g. when invoking a
method that is read-only, it will ask only for a read-only scope. 
You may use the 
--scope
 flag to specify a scope directly. 
All applicable scopes are documented in the respective method's CLI documentation.


The first time a scope is used, the user is asked for permission. Follow the instructions given 
by the CLI to grant permissions, or to decline.


If a scope was authenticated by the user, the respective information will be stored as 
JSON
 in the configuration
directory, e.g. 
~/.google-service-cli/drive2-token-
scope-hash
.json
. No manual management of these tokens
is necessary.


To revoke granted authentication, please refer to the 
official documentation
.


Application Secrets


In order to allow any application to use Google services, it will need to be registered using the 

Google Developer Console
. APIs the application may use are then enabled for it
one by one. Most APIs can be used for free and have a daily quota.


To allow more comfortable usage of the CLI without forcing anyone to register an own application, the CLI
comes with a default application secret that is configured accordingly. This also means that heavy usage
all around the world may deplete the daily quota.


You can workaround this limitation by putting your own secrets file at this location: 

~/.google-service-cli/drive2-secret.json
, assuming that the required 
drive
 API 
was enabled for it. Such a secret file can be downloaded in the 
Google Developer Console
 at 

APIs 
 auth -
 Credentials -
 Download JSON
 and used as is.


Learn more about how to setup Google projects and enable APIs using the 
official documentation
.


Debugging


Even though the CLI does its best to provide usable error messages, sometimes it might be desirable to know
what exactly led to a particular issue. This is done by allowing all client-server communication to be 
output to standard error 
as-is
.


The 
--debug
 flag will print all client-server communication to standard error, whereas the 
--debug-auth
 flag
will cause all communication related to authentication to standard error.
If the 
--debug
 flag is set, error-results will be debug-printed, possibly yielding more information about the 
issue at hand.


You may consider redirecting standard error into a file for ease of use, e.g. 
drive2 --debug 
resource
 
method
 [options] 2
debug.txt
.

docs.text:
Gets the information about the current user along with Drive API settings


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.photos.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata.readonly
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 about get ...


Optional Output Flags


The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.




-o out


out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination
 may be 
-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.








Optional Method Properties


You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p
 is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

-p
 for completeness.






-p include-subscribed=boolean




When calculating the number of remaining change IDs, whether to include public files the user has opened and shared files. When set to false, this counts only change IDs for owned files and any shared or public files that the user has explicitly added to a folder they own.








-p max-change-id-count=string




Maximum number of remaining change IDs to count








-p start-change-id=string




Change ID to start counting from when calculating number of remaining change IDs








Optional General Properties


The following properties can configure any call, and are not specific to this method.






-p alt=string




Data format for the response.








-p fields=string




Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.








-p key=string




API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.








-p oauth-token=string




OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.








-p pretty-print=boolean




Returns response with indentations and line breaks.








-p quota-user=string




Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.








-p user-ip=string




IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

docs.text:
Gets a specific app.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 apps get ...


Required Scalar Argument




app-id
 
(string)


The ID of the app.

(string)

Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.

  anchor: string
  author:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  comment-id: string
  content: string

    value: string

  deleted: boolean
  file-id: string
  file-title: string
  html-content: string

.

Required Scalar Arguments

(string)

(string)

Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.

s content.

The MIME type of the context snippet.








value=rebum.




Data representation of the segment of the file being commented on. In the case of a text file for example, this would be the actual text that the comment is about.

The date when this comment was first created.






deleted=true


Whether this comment has been deleted. If a comment has been deleted the content will be cleared and this will only represent a comment that once existed.

The file which this comment is addressing.






file-title=sadipscing


The title of the file which this comment is addressing.

.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.

...

destination

Creates a copy of the specified file.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.photos.readonly




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files copy ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file to copy.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


File:
  alternate-link: string
  app-data-contents: boolean
  can-comment: boolean
  copyable: boolean
  created-date: string
  default-open-with-link: string
  description: string
  download-url: string
  editable: boolean
  embed-link: string
  etag: string
  explicitly-trashed: boolean
  export-links: { string: string }
  file-extension: string
  file-size: string
  folder-color-rgb: string
  full-file-extension: string
  head-revision-id: string
  icon-link: string
  id: string
  image-media-metadata:
    aperture: number
    camera-make: string
    camera-model: string
    color-space: string
    date: string
    exposure-bias: number
    exposure-mode: string
    exposure-time: number
    flash-used: boolean
    focal-length: number
    height: integer
    iso-speed: integer
    lens: string
    location:
      altitude: number
      latitude: number
      longitude: number
    max-aperture-value: number
    metering-mode: string
    rotation: integer
    sensor: string
    subject-distance: integer
    white-balance: string
    width: integer
  indexable-text:
    text: string
  kind: string
  labels:
    hidden: boolean
    restricted: boolean
    starred: boolean
    trashed: boolean
    viewed: boolean
  last-modifying-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  last-modifying-user-name: string
  last-viewed-by-me-date: string
  marked-viewed-by-me-date: string
  md5-checksum: string
  mime-type: string
  modified-by-me-date: string
  modified-date: string
  open-with-links: { string: string }
  original-filename: string
  owned-by-me: boolean
  owner-names: [string]
  quota-bytes-used: string
  self-link: string
  shareable: boolean
  shared: boolean
  shared-with-me-date: string
  sharing-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  spaces: [string]
  thumbnail:
    image: string
    mime-type: string
  thumbnail-link: string
  title: string
  user-permission:
    additional-roles: [string]
    auth-key: string
    domain: string
    email-address: string
    etag: string
    id: string
    kind: string
    name: string
    photo-link: string
    role: string
    self-link: string
    type: string
    value: string
    with-link: boolean
  version: string
  video-media-metadata:
    duration-millis: string
    height: integer
    width: integer
  web-content-link: string
  web-view-link: string
  writers-can-share: boolean





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    alternate-link=lorem


A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.






app-data-contents=true


Whether this file is in the Application Data folder.






can-comment=true


Whether the current user can comment on the file.






copyable=true


Whether the file can be copied by the current user.






created-date=takimata


Create time for this file (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






default-open-with-link=nonumy


A link to open this file with the user
s default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.






description=kasd


A short description of the file.






download-url=sanctus


No description provided.






editable=false


Whether the file can be edited by the current user.






embed-link=at


A link for embedding the file.






etag=labore


ETag of the file.






explicitly-trashed=true


Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.






export-links=key=ea


Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.


the value will be associated with the given 
key






file-extension=sadipscing


The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






file-size=rebum.


The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






folder-color-rgb=dolore


Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.






full-file-extension=nonumy


The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as 
tar.gz
. Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






head-revision-id=sed


The ID of the file
s head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






icon-link=aliquyam


A link to the file
s icon.






id=sit


The ID of the file.

The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).

The make of the camera used to create the photo.






camera-model=labore


The model of the camera used to create the photo.






color-space=sed


The color space of the photo.

exposure-bias=0.392950472417

exposure-time=0.76272977112

focal-length=0.417527511227

height=16

iso-speed=47


The ISO speed used to create the photo.






lens=aliquyam


The lens used to create the photo.






location    altitude=0.321672275956

latitude=0.0302365164456


The latitude stored in the image.








longitude=0.599946232081




The longitude stored in the image.








..    max-aperture-value=0.641306157689




The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).






metering-mode=justo


The metering mode used to create the photo.






rotation=95


The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image
s original orientation.






sensor=amet


The type of sensor used to create the photo.






subject-distance=78


The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.






white-balance=clita


The white balance mode used to create the photo.








width=22




The width of the image in pixels.

The text to be indexed for this file.








..    kind=est




The type of file. This is always drive#file.






labels    hidden=false


Deprecated.






restricted=true

starred=false


Whether this file is starred by the user.






trashed=true


Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.








viewed=true




Whether this file has been viewed by this user.








..last-modifying-user    display-name=voluptua.




A plain text displayable name for this user.






email-address=duo


The email address of the user.






is-authenticated-user=false


Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.






kind=aliquyam


This is always drive#user.






permission-id=ea


The user
s ID as visible in the permissions collection.








picture    url=ea




A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.








...    last-modifying-user-name=et




Name of the last user to modify this file.






last-viewed-by-me-date=dolor


Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






marked-viewed-by-me-date=diam


Deprecated.






md5-checksum=kasd


An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






mime-type=invidunt


The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content
s MIME type.






modified-by-me-date=rebum.


Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.

Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.






open-with-links=key=clita


A map of the id of each of the user
s apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.


the value will be associated with the given 
key

The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. A link back to this permission.

group

value=et

The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.  For example, a structure like this:  File:

  app-data-contents: boolean

  copyable: boolean

  description: string

  explicitly-trashed: boolean
  export-links: { string: string }
  file-extension: string
  file-size: string
  folder-color-rgb: string
  full-file-extension: string
  head-revision-id: string
  icon-link: string
  id: string
  image-media-metadata:
    aperture: number

    camera-model: string
    color-space: string
    date: string

    exposure-mode: string
    exposure-time: number
    flash-used: boolean

    height: integer

    lens: string
    location:
      altitude: number
      latitude: number
      longitude: number
    max-aperture-value: number
    metering-mode: string
    rotation: integer
    sensor: string

    white-balance: string
    width: integer
  indexable-text:
    text: string
  kind: string
  labels:

  last-modifying-user:
    display-name: string

      url: string
  last-modifying-user-name: string
  last-viewed-by-me-date: string
  marked-viewed-by-me-date: string
  md5-checksum: string
  mime-type: string
  modified-by-me-date: string
  modified-date: string
  open-with-links: { string: string }
  original-filename: string
  owned-by-me: boolean
  owner-names: [string]
  quota-bytes-used: string

  shareable: boolean
  shared: boolean
  shared-with-me-date: string
  sharing-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string

      url: string

  thumbnail:
    image: string

    additional-roles: [string]

  web-content-link: string
  web-view-link: string
  writers-can-share: boolean  can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.   -r .    alternate-link=lorem  A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.    app-data-contents=true  Whether this file is in the Application Data folder.    can-comment=true  Whether the current user can comment on the file.    copyable=true  Whether the file can be copied by the current user.    created-date=takimata  Create time for this file (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).    default-open-with-link=nonumy  A link to open this file with the user s default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.    description=kasd  A short description of the file.    download-url=sanctus  No description provided.    editable=false  Whether the file can be edited by the current user.    embed-link=at  A link for embedding the file.    etag=labore  ETag of the file.    explicitly-trashed=true  Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.    export-links=key=ea  Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.  the value will be associated with the given  key    file-extension=sadipscing  The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    file-size=rebum.  The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    folder-color-rgb=dolore  Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.    full-file-extension=nonumy  The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as  tar.gz . Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    head-revision-id=sed  The ID of the file s head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    icon-link=aliquyam  A link to the file s icon.    id=sit  The ID of the file.    image-media-metadata    aperture=0.613172139448  The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).    camera-make=consetetur  The make of the camera used to create the photo.    camera-model=labore  The model of the camera used to create the photo.    color-space=sed  The color space of the photo.    date=ea  The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).    exposure-bias=0.392950472417  The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).    exposure-mode=aliquyam  The exposure mode used to create the photo.    exposure-time=0.76272977112  The length of the exposure, in seconds.    flash-used=true  Whether a flash was used to create the photo.    focal-length=0.417527511227  The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.    height=16  The height of the image in pixels.    iso-speed=47  The ISO speed used to create the photo.    lens=aliquyam  The lens used to create the photo.    location    altitude=0.321672275956  The altitude stored in the image.    latitude=0.0302365164456  The latitude stored in the image.     longitude=0.599946232081   The longitude stored in the image.     ..    max-aperture-value=0.641306157689   The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).    metering-mode=justo  The metering mode used to create the photo.    rotation=95  The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image s original orientation.    sensor=amet  The type of sensor used to create the photo.    subject-distance=78  The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.    white-balance=clita  The white balance mode used to create the photo.     width=22   The width of the image in pixels.     ..indexable-text    text=justo   The text to be indexed for this file.     ..    kind=est   The type of file. This is always drive#file.    labels    hidden=false  Deprecated.    restricted=true  Whether viewers and commenters are prevented from downloading, printing, and copying this file.    starred=false  Whether this file is starred by the user.    trashed=true  Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.     viewed=true   Whether this file has been viewed by this user.     ..last-modifying-user    display-name=voluptua.   A plain text displayable name for this user.    email-address=duo  The email address of the user.    is-authenticated-user=false  Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.    kind=aliquyam  This is always drive#user.    permission-id=ea  The user s ID as visible in the permissions collection.     picture    url=ea   A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.     ...    last-modifying-user-name=et   Name of the last user to modify this file.    last-viewed-by-me-date=dolor  Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).    marked-viewed-by-me-date=diam  Deprecated.    md5-checksum=kasd  An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    mime-type=invidunt  The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content s MIME type.    modified-by-me-date=rebum.  Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.    modified-date=lorem  Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.    open-with-links=key=clita  A map of the id of each of the user s apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.  the value will be associated with the given  key    original-filename=invidunt  The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    owned-by-me=false  Whether the file is owned by the current user.    owner-names=at  Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file.  Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    quota-bytes-used=consetetur  The number of quota bytes used by this file.    self-link=et  A link back to this file.    shareable=false  Whether the file s sharing settings can be modified by the current user.    shared=true  Whether the file has been shared.    shared-with-me-date=takimata  Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).    sharing-user    display-name=elitr  A plain text displayable name for this user.    email-address=nonumy  The email address of the user.    is-authenticated-user=true  Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.    kind=lorem  This is always drive#user.    permission-id=lorem  The user s ID as visible in the permissions collection.     picture    url=diam   A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.     ...    spaces=ut   The list of spaces which contain the file. Supported values are  drive ,  appDataFolder  and  photos .  Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    thumbnail    image=ut  The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image. It should conform to RFC 4648 section 5.     mime-type=amet.   The MIME type of the thumbnail.     ..    thumbnail-link=ipsum   A short-lived link to the file s thumbnail. Typically lasts on the order of hours.    title=ut  The title of this file.    user-permission    additional-roles=dolor  Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.  Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    auth-key=sea  The authkey parameter required for this permission.    domain=ut  The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.    email-address=eirmod  The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.    etag=sanctus  The ETag of the permission.    id=voluptua.  The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.    kind=dolor  This is always drive#permission.    name=et  The name for this permission.    photo-link=et  A link to the profile photo, if available.    role=vero  The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:    owner   reader   writer      self-link=ut  A link back to this permission.    type=sed  The account type. Allowed values are:    user   group   domain   anyone      value=et  The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.     with-link=false   Whether the link is required for this permission.     ..    version=justo   A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.    video-media-metadata    duration-millis=dolore  The duration of the video in milliseconds.    height=75  The height of the video in pixels.     width=2   The width of the video in pixels.     ..    web-content-link=takimata   A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.    web-view-link=et  A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive s Website Hosting.    writers-can-share=false  Whether writers can share the document with other users.     About Cursors  The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:   The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the  .  character. Fields can be nested such as in  -r f.s.o  .  The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with  . , e.g.  -r .s.s  You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify  -r struct.sub_struct=bar .  You can move the cursor one level up by using  .. . Each additional  .  moves it up one additional level. E.g.  ...  would go three levels up.

docs.text:
The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.  As this method supports  media download , you may specify the  -p alt=media  flag to set the output to be an octet stream of the underlying media. In that case, you will not receive JSON output anymore.   -o out  out  specifies the  destination  to which to write the server's result to.
  It will either be a JSON-encoded structure, or the media file you are downloading.
  The  destination  may be  -  to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

docs.text:
Insert a new file.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files insert ...


Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:

  app-data-contents: boolean
  can-comment: boolean

  default-open-with-link: string

  download-url: string
  editable: boolean
  embed-link: string

  explicitly-trashed: boolean
  export-links: { string: string }
  file-extension: string
  file-size: string
  folder-color-rgb: string
  full-file-extension: string
  head-revision-id: string
  icon-link: string
  id: string
  image-media-metadata:
    aperture: number
    camera-make: string
    camera-model: string
    color-space: string
    date: string
    exposure-bias: number
    exposure-mode: string
    exposure-time: number
    flash-used: boolean
    focal-length: number
    height: integer
    iso-speed: integer
    lens: string
    location:
      altitude: number
      latitude: number
      longitude: number
    max-aperture-value: number
    metering-mode: string
    rotation: integer
    sensor: string
    subject-distance: integer
    white-balance: string
    width: integer
  indexable-text:
    text: string
  kind: string
  labels:
    hidden: boolean
    restricted: boolean
    starred: boolean
    trashed: boolean
    viewed: boolean
  last-modifying-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  last-modifying-user-name: string
  last-viewed-by-me-date: string
  marked-viewed-by-me-date: string
  md5-checksum: string
  mime-type: string
  modified-by-me-date: string
  modified-date: string
  open-with-links: { string: string }
  original-filename: string
  owned-by-me: boolean
  owner-names: [string]
  quota-bytes-used: string
  self-link: string
  shareable: boolean
  shared: boolean
  shared-with-me-date: string
  sharing-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  spaces: [string]

    image: string

  version: string
  video-media-metadata:
    duration-millis: string
    height: integer
    width: integer
  web-content-link: string
  web-view-link: string
  writers-can-share: boolean





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.

A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.

Whether this file is in the Application Data folder.

Whether the current user can comment on the file.

Whether the file can be copied by the current user.

Create time for this file (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

A link to open this file with the user
s default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.

A short description of the file.

Whether the file can be edited by the current user.

Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.


the value will be associated with the given 
key

The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






file-size=diam


The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






folder-color-rgb=accusam


Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.






full-file-extension=dolores


The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as 
tar.gz
. Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






head-revision-id=consetetur


The ID of the file
s head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






icon-link=dolor


A link to the file
s icon.






id=aliquyam


The ID of the file.






image-media-metadata    aperture=0.0737731908831


The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).

The make of the camera used to create the photo.






camera-model=et


The model of the camera used to create the photo.

metering-mode=magna

s original orientation.

The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content

A map of the id of each of the user

key

The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

s Website Hosting.

About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.




Required Upload Flags


This method supports the upload of data, which 
requires
 all of the following flags to be set:




-u (simple|resumable)


simple
 - Upload media all at once.


resumable
 - Upload media in a resumable fashion.






-f file


Path to file to upload. It must be seekable.








The following flag 
may
 be set: 




-m mime


the mime type, like 'application/octet-stream', which is the default








Optional Output Flags


The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.




-o out


out

destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination

-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

The visibility of the new file. This parameter is only relevant when convert=false.

Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.

The timed text track name.

Whether to use the content as indexable text.

This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    icon-link=dolor  A link to the file s icon.    id=aliquyam  The ID of the file.    image-media-metadata    aperture=0.0737731908831  The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).    camera-make=ea  The make of the camera used to create the photo.    camera-model=et  The model of the camera used to create the photo.    color-space=stet  The color space of the photo.    date=sed  The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).    exposure-bias=0.0276922285568  The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).    exposure-mode=sanctus  The exposure mode used to create the photo.    exposure-time=0.679100110477  The length of the exposure, in seconds.    flash-used=true  Whether a flash was used to create the photo.    focal-length=0.05919685617  The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.    height=55  The height of the image in pixels.    iso-speed=11  The ISO speed used to create the photo.    lens=labore  The lens used to create the photo.    location    altitude=0.398250639129  The altitude stored in the image.    latitude=0.278342757538  The latitude stored in the image.     longitude=0.56216559497   The longitude stored in the image.     ..    max-aperture-value=0.28706354019   The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).    metering-mode=magna  The metering mode used to create the photo.    rotation=0  The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image s original orientation.    sensor=rebum.  The type of sensor used to create the photo.    subject-distance=30  The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.    white-balance=clita  The white balance mode used to create the photo.     width=77   The width of the image in pixels.     ..indexable-text    text=dolores   The text to be indexed for this file.     ..    kind=vero   The type of file. This is always drive#file.    labels    hidden=false  Deprecated.    restricted=true  Whether viewers and commenters are prevented from downloading, printing, and copying this file.    starred=false  Whether this file is starred by the user.    trashed=true  Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.     viewed=true   Whether this file has been viewed by this user.     ..last-modifying-user    display-name=tempor   A plain text displayable name for this user.    email-address=gubergren  The email address of the user.    is-authenticated-user=false  Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.    kind=amet.  This is always drive#user.    permission-id=dolore  The user s ID as visible in the permissions collection.     picture    url=magna   A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.     ...    last-modifying-user-name=elitr   Name of the last user to modify this file.    last-viewed-by-me-date=magna  Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).    marked-viewed-by-me-date=ipsum  Deprecated.    md5-checksum=invidunt  An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    mime-type=accusam  The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content s MIME type.    modified-by-me-date=labore  Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.    modified-date=diam  Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.    open-with-links=key=nonumy  A map of the id of each of the user s apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.  the value will be associated with the given  key    original-filename=sed  The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    owned-by-me=false  Whether the file is owned by the current user.    owner-names=magna  Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file.  Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    quota-bytes-used=dolor  The number of quota bytes used by this file.    self-link=lorem  A link back to this file.    shareable=true  Whether the file s sharing settings can be modified by the current user.    shared=true  Whether the file has been shared.    shared-with-me-date=nonumy  Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).    sharing-user    display-name=takimata  A plain text displayable name for this user.    email-address=dolores  The email address of the user.    is-authenticated-user=false  Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.    kind=erat  This is always drive#user.    permission-id=amet.  The user s ID as visible in the permissions collection.     picture    url=dolores   A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.     ...    spaces=dolores   The list of spaces which contain the file. Supported values are  drive ,  appDataFolder  and  photos .  Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    thumbnail    image=et  The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image. It should conform to RFC 4648 section 5.     mime-type=sed   The MIME type of the thumbnail.     ..    thumbnail-link=et   A short-lived link to the file s thumbnail. Typically lasts on the order of hours.    title=aliquyam  The title of this file.    user-permission    additional-roles=nonumy  Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.  Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    auth-key=sit  The authkey parameter required for this permission.    domain=aliquyam  The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.    email-address=sadipscing  The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.    etag=magna  The ETag of the permission.    id=gubergren  The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.    kind=sit  This is always drive#permission.    name=gubergren  The name for this permission.    photo-link=sit  A link to the profile photo, if available.    role=amet  The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:    owner   reader   writer      self-link=eirmod  A link back to this permission.    type=sanctus  The account type. Allowed values are:    user   group   domain   anyone      value=lorem  The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.     with-link=true   Whether the link is required for this permission.     ..    version=diam   A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.    video-media-metadata    duration-millis=eirmod  The duration of the video in milliseconds.    height=56  The height of the video in pixels.     width=96   The width of the video in pixels.     ..    web-content-link=sed   A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.    web-view-link=sit  A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive s Website Hosting.    writers-can-share=true  Whether writers can share the document with other users.     About Cursors  The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:   The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the  .  character. Fields can be nested such as in  -r f.s.o  .  The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with  . , e.g.  -r .s.s  You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify  -r struct.sub_struct=bar .  You can move the cursor one level up by using  .. . Each additional  .  moves it up one additional level. E.g.  ...  would go three levels up.

docs.text: This method supports the upload of data, which  requires  all of the following flags to be set:   -u (simple|resumable)  simple  - Upload media all at once.  resumable  - Upload media in a resumable fashion.    -f file  Path to file to upload. It must be seekable.     The following flag  may  be set:    -m mime  the mime type, like 'application/octet-stream', which is the default

Scopes

.

,

,

.

This parameter is deprecated and has no function.

docs.text:
Updates file metadata and/or content. This method supports patch semantics.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.scripts




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files patch ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file to update.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


File:
  alternate-link: string
  app-data-contents: boolean
  can-comment: boolean
  copyable: boolean
  created-date: string
  default-open-with-link: string
  description: string
  download-url: string
  editable: boolean
  embed-link: string
  etag: string
  explicitly-trashed: boolean
  export-links: { string: string }
  file-extension: string
  file-size: string
  folder-color-rgb: string
  full-file-extension: string
  head-revision-id: string
  icon-link: string
  id: string
  image-media-metadata:
    aperture: number
    camera-make: string
    camera-model: string
    color-space: string
    date: string
    exposure-bias: number
    exposure-mode: string
    exposure-time: number
    flash-used: boolean
    focal-length: number
    height: integer
    iso-speed: integer
    lens: string
    location:
      altitude: number
      latitude: number
      longitude: number
    max-aperture-value: number
    metering-mode: string
    rotation: integer
    sensor: string
    subject-distance: integer
    white-balance: string
    width: integer
  indexable-text:
    text: string
  kind: string
  labels:
    hidden: boolean
    restricted: boolean
    starred: boolean
    trashed: boolean
    viewed: boolean
  last-modifying-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  last-modifying-user-name: string
  last-viewed-by-me-date: string
  marked-viewed-by-me-date: string
  md5-checksum: string
  mime-type: string
  modified-by-me-date: string
  modified-date: string
  open-with-links: { string: string }
  original-filename: string
  owned-by-me: boolean
  owner-names: [string]
  quota-bytes-used: string
  self-link: string
  shareable: boolean
  shared: boolean
  shared-with-me-date: string
  sharing-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  spaces: [string]
  thumbnail:
    image: string
    mime-type: string
  thumbnail-link: string
  title: string
  user-permission:
    additional-roles: [string]
    auth-key: string
    domain: string
    email-address: string
    etag: string
    id: string
    kind: string
    name: string
    photo-link: string
    role: string
    self-link: string

    value: string
    with-link: boolean
  version: string
  video-media-metadata:
    duration-millis: string
    height: integer
    width: integer
  web-content-link: string
  web-view-link: string
  writers-can-share: boolean

About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.

-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.

 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

-p new-revision=boolean




Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.

Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.

Whether to pin the new revision. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.

-p timed-text-track-name=string




The timed text track name.

Determines the behavior in which modifiedDate is updated. This overrides setModifiedDate.

In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.  For example, a structure like this:  File:

Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.    description=et  A short description of the file.    download-url=erat  No description provided.    editable=true  Whether the file can be edited by the current user.    embed-link=kasd  A link for embedding the file.    etag=et  ETag of the file.    explicitly-trashed=false  Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.    export-links=key=sed  Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.  the value will be associated with the given  key    file-extension=dolores  The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    file-size=clita  The size of the file in bytes. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.    full-file-extension=amet  The full file extension; extracted from the title. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    head-revision-id=sed  The ID of the file s head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.    icon-link=takimata  A link to the file s icon.    id=sit  The ID of the file.    image-media-metadata    aperture=0.151270886745  The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).    camera-make=nonumy  The make of the camera used to create the photo.    camera-model=erat  The model of the camera used to create the photo.    color-space=gubergren  The color space of the photo.    date=erat  The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).    exposure-bias=0.163116269945  The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).    exposure-mode=amet  The exposure mode used to create the photo.    exposure-time=0.00226681720917  The length of the exposure, in seconds.    flash-used=false  Whether a flash was used to create the photo.    focal-length=0.351715729562  The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.    height=31  The height of the image in pixels.    iso-speed=66  The ISO speed used to create the photo.    lens=voluptua. Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.    modified-date=sanctus  Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Moves a file to the trash. The currently authenticated user must own the file.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files trash ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file to trash.








Optional Output Flags

-o out


out

destination
 to which to write the server's result to.

  The 
destination

-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

docs.text:
Updates file metadata and/or content.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.scripts




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files update ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file to update.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


File:
  alternate-link: string
  app-data-contents: boolean
  can-comment: boolean
  copyable: boolean
  created-date: string
  default-open-with-link: string
  description: string
  download-url: string
  editable: boolean
  embed-link: string
  etag: string
  explicitly-trashed: boolean
  export-links: { string: string }
  file-extension: string
  file-size: string
  folder-color-rgb: string
  full-file-extension: string
  head-revision-id: string
  icon-link: string
  id: string
  image-media-metadata:
    aperture: number
    camera-make: string
    camera-model: string
    color-space: string
    date: string
    exposure-bias: number
    exposure-mode: string
    exposure-time: number
    flash-used: boolean
    focal-length: number
    height: integer
    iso-speed: integer
    lens: string
    location:
      altitude: number
      latitude: number
      longitude: number
    max-aperture-value: number
    metering-mode: string
    rotation: integer
    sensor: string
    subject-distance: integer
    white-balance: string
    width: integer
  indexable-text:
    text: string
  kind: string
  labels:
    hidden: boolean
    restricted: boolean
    starred: boolean
    trashed: boolean
    viewed: boolean
  last-modifying-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  last-modifying-user-name: string
  last-viewed-by-me-date: string
  marked-viewed-by-me-date: string
  md5-checksum: string
  mime-type: string
  modified-by-me-date: string
  modified-date: string
  open-with-links: { string: string }
  original-filename: string
  owned-by-me: boolean
  owner-names: [string]
  quota-bytes-used: string
  self-link: string
  shareable: boolean
  shared: boolean
  shared-with-me-date: string
  sharing-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  spaces: [string]
  thumbnail:
    image: string
    mime-type: string
  thumbnail-link: string
  title: string
  user-permission:
    additional-roles: [string]
    auth-key: string
    domain: string
    email-address: string
    etag: string
    id: string
    kind: string
    name: string
    photo-link: string
    role: string
    self-link: string
    type: string
    value: string
    with-link: boolean
  version: string
  video-media-metadata:
    duration-millis: string
    height: integer
    width: integer
  web-content-link: string
  web-view-link: string
  writers-can-share: boolean





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    alternate-link=kasd


A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.






app-data-contents=false


Whether this file is in the Application Data folder.






can-comment=true


Whether the current user can comment on the file.






copyable=true


Whether the file can be copied by the current user.






created-date=nonumy


Create time for this file (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






default-open-with-link=sanctus


A link to open this file with the user
s default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.






description=voluptua.


A short description of the file.






download-url=labore


No description provided.






editable=true


Whether the file can be edited by the current user.






embed-link=erat


A link for embedding the file.






etag=voluptua.


ETag of the file.






explicitly-trashed=true


Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.






export-links=key=consetetur


Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.


the value will be associated with the given 
key






file-extension=tempor


The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






file-size=amet


The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






folder-color-rgb=lorem


Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.






full-file-extension=eirmod


The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as 
tar.gz
. Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






head-revision-id=elitr


The ID of the file
s head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






icon-link=clita


A link to the file
s icon.






id=et


The ID of the file.






image-media-metadata    aperture=0.616755074428


The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).






camera-make=ea


The make of the camera used to create the photo.






camera-model=et


The model of the camera used to create the photo.






color-space=sed


The color space of the photo.






date=sanctus


The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).






exposure-bias=0.917395236402


The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).






exposure-mode=ipsum


The exposure mode used to create the photo.






exposure-time=0.395017451116


The length of the exposure, in seconds.






flash-used=true


Whether a flash was used to create the photo.






focal-length=0.714368806623


The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.






height=3


The height of the image in pixels.






iso-speed=62


The ISO speed used to create the photo.






lens=stet


The lens used to create the photo.






location    altitude=0.910337635131


The altitude stored in the image.






latitude=0.437148261244


The latitude stored in the image.








longitude=0.399302648226




The longitude stored in the image.








..    max-aperture-value=0.447231179207




The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).






metering-mode=invidunt


The metering mode used to create the photo.






rotation=23


The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image
s original orientation.






sensor=erat


The type of sensor used to create the photo.






subject-distance=52


The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.






white-balance=no


The white balance mode used to create the photo.








width=75




The width of the image in pixels.








..indexable-text    text=sed




The text to be indexed for this file.








..    kind=vero




The type of file. This is always drive#file.






labels    hidden=false


Deprecated.






restricted=false


Whether viewers and commenters are prevented from downloading, printing, and copying this file.






starred=true


Whether this file is starred by the user.






trashed=false


Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.








viewed=false




Whether this file has been viewed by this user.








..last-modifying-user    display-name=accusam




A plain text displayable name for this user.






email-address=diam


The email address of the user.






is-authenticated-user=false


Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.






kind=eirmod


This is always drive#user.






permission-id=amet


The user
s ID as visible in the permissions collection.








picture    url=ipsum




A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.








...    last-modifying-user-name=voluptua.




Name of the last user to modify this file.






last-viewed-by-me-date=eirmod


Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






marked-viewed-by-me-date=sed


Deprecated.






md5-checksum=accusam


An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






mime-type=sanctus


The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content
s MIME type.






modified-by-me-date=dolor


Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.






modified-date=dolor


Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.






open-with-links=key=dolore


A map of the id of each of the user
s apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.


the value will be associated with the given 
key






original-filename=duo


The original filename if the file was uploaded manually, or the original title if the file was inserted through the API. Note that renames of the title will not change the original filename. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






owned-by-me=false


Whether the file is owned by the current user.






owner-names=diam


Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






quota-bytes-used=sed


The number of quota bytes used by this file.






self-link=et


A link back to this file.






shareable=true


Whether the file
s sharing settings can be modified by the current user.






shared=true


Whether the file has been shared.






shared-with-me-date=takimata


Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






sharing-user    display-name=invidunt


A plain text displayable name for this user.






email-address=amet


The email address of the user.






is-authenticated-user=false


Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.






kind=voluptua.


This is always drive#user.






permission-id=et


The user
s ID as visible in the permissions collection.








picture    url=elitr




A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.








...    spaces=kasd




The list of spaces which contain the file. Supported values are 
drive
, 
appDataFolder
 and 
photos
.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






thumbnail    image=sit


The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image. It should conform to RFC 4648 section 5.








mime-type=justo




The MIME type of the thumbnail.








..    thumbnail-link=gubergren




A short-lived link to the file
s thumbnail. Typically lasts on the order of hours.






title=ipsum


The title of this file.






user-permission    additional-roles=amet.


Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






auth-key=dolor


The authkey parameter required for this permission.






domain=sanctus


The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.






email-address=ut


The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.






etag=magna


The ETag of the permission.






id=amet.


The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.






kind=eirmod


This is always drive#permission.






name=ea


The name for this permission.






photo-link=ea


A link to the profile photo, if available.






role=et


The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:  


owner 


reader 


writer










self-link=sanctus


A link back to this permission.






type=diam


The account type. Allowed values are:  


user 


group 


domain 


anyone










value=eos


The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified.








with-link=true




Whether the link is required for this permission.








..    version=sea




A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.






video-media-metadata    duration-millis=ea


The duration of the video in milliseconds.






height=10


The height of the video in pixels.








width=31




The width of the video in pixels.








..    web-content-link=tempor




A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.






web-view-link=consetetur


A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive
s Website Hosting.






writers-can-share=false


Whether writers can share the document with other users.








About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.




Required Upload Flags


This method supports the upload of data, which 
requires
 all of the following flags to be set:




-u (simple|resumable)


simple
 - Upload media all at once.


resumable
 - Upload media in a resumable fashion.






-f file


Path to file to upload. It must be seekable.








The following flag 
may
 be set: 




-m mime


the mime type, like 'application/octet-stream', which is the default








Optional Output Flags


The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.




-o out


out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination
 may be 
-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.








Optional Method Properties


You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p
 is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

-p
 for completeness.






-p use-content-as-indexable-text=boolean




Whether to use the content as indexable text.








-p remove-parents=string




Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.








-p ocr=boolean




Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.








-p convert=boolean




This parameter is deprecated and has no function.








-p modified-date-behavior=string




Determines the behavior in which modifiedDate is updated. This overrides setModifiedDate.








-p pinned=boolean




Whether to pin the new revision. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.








-p timed-text-language=string




The language of the timed text.








-p timed-text-track-name=string




The timed text track name.








-p ocr-language=string




If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.








-p new-revision=boolean




Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.








-p add-parents=string




Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.








-p set-modified-date=boolean




Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.








-p update-viewed-date=boolean




Whether to update the view date after successfully updating the file.
